This action has no configurable parameters.
Actions of this type may be potentially dangerous and cause damage if, for example, the trigger is fired with parameters that fall outside of the expected values. Please be aware of the risk.

If the response firing expression has been defined, an log line will be generated from the result of the evaluted string expression. The log line will be processed like any other, as if it came from ACT itself.
To add the response from the endpoint to this expression, special variable "_response" is available. The special variable will only be valid in the context of this action's execution.
The SendKeys keypress format, including how to represent modifier keys such as Shift, is described on this webpage:
The window message format can send one key at a time, and modifier keys such as Shift are represented as additions to the original keycode. Keycode constants are described on this webpage:
If you are using OBS v27 or older, you will have to install the OBS WebSocket plugin to use OBS remote control features. There is a simple installer available at:
Actions of this type may be potentially dangerous and cause damage if, for example, the trigger is fired with parameters that fall outside of the expected values. Please be aware of the risk.
You are in read-only mode, as the configuration of remote triggers can't be edited locally. If you wish to edit the action, you will need to make a local copy of the trigger.
If the trigger fires again while this action is still in queue
Actions of this type may be potentially dangerous and cause damage if, for example, the trigger is fired with parameters that fall outside of the expected values. Please be aware of the risk.

I'm ready to start! Let's go!
Show this Welcome Screen on startup

When you close this Welcome Screen, you will see Triggernometry's main user interface. Simply select the folder where you want to create a trigger to (or Root), and hit the Add button in the top-left corner.
This is the button you should be looking out for:
How can I create a new trigger?

Triggernometry provides extended capabilities, such as more action types (auras and such), and conditional execution where certain actions are only taken if conditions are met (for example, player name needs to be something specific).
How is this different from usual ACT triggers?

It's very similar to creating a trigger. After this screen, you can select the folder where you want to import all the triggers to (or Root), and then hit the Import button on the top bar.
This is the button you should be looking out for:
I have this XML file which is supposed to have some triggers. How do I use it?
Here are some answers to commonly asked questions to get you started:

Triggernometry has a Discord server available, where you will be able to ask questions, find triggers, and get the latest plugin updates. You'll also find examples and detailed information about how different operations behave. Feel free to join us at:
Where can I find more resources, triggers, or help with Triggernometry?

Plugins such as SpecialSpellTimer and Cactbot provide great generalized tools and functionality out of the box, with no extra fuss.
Triggernometry is more of a DIY building kit, providing you with accessible options to build your own custom tools and functionality. It doesn't come with timelines or callouts out of the box, and as such it's a little bit more involved to get started with.
How is this different from SpecialSpellTimer or Cactbot?
